text: Kate Wilhelm (June 8, 1928 â€“ March 8, 2018) was an American author. She wrote works in science fiction, fantasy and mystery, including the Hugo Award- winning Where Late the Sweet Birds Sang, and established writer workshops with her husband Damon Knight. She won a Hugo Award in 1977 and won multiple Nebula Awards in 1968, 1986 and 1987. Wilhelm died in Eugene, Oregon on March 8, 2018 at the age of 89. ==References== ==Other websites== * Infinity Box Press, Wilhelm's publishing company Category:1928 births Category:2018 deaths Category:American science fiction writers Category:Writers from Oregon Category:Writers from Toledo, Ohio Category:People from Eugene, Oregon
title: Kate Wilhelm
